events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 30, providing initial details for the insurance claim.
Claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to manage the case and guide the customer through the process.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed the start of the claim process.
Customer was requested to submit photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates to support the claim.
All requested documentation including police report, vehicle pictures, and repair shop estimates were received from the customer.
The claim investigation began, focusing on verifying the damage details and validating the circumstances of the accident.
Investigation successfully completed, confirming the damage and fault assessment as reported by the customer.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on the investigation findings and repair cost estimates.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the communication and support.
Claim was approved following customer acceptance of the settlement offer, allowing payment processing to begin.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued to the customer's repair shop to cover the car damages.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion.
The claim file was archived within the insurance system for record keeping and future reference purposes.
